Interface_name: TCP Client - side by using socket in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a TCP client class for managing connections to a server, sending and receiving commands, and handling various server messages.

Class Description: The Client class provides functionality to connect to a server, send and receive commands, and maintain client state including client ID, room information, and attributes. It handles connection management, message processing, and error handling.

Attributes:
- host: str - The server host address to connect to
- port: int - The server port to connect to
- pending_commands: List[common.Command] - Commands waiting to be sent to the server
- socket: Socket - The socket connection to the server
- client_id: Optional[str] - The unique ID assigned by the server
- current_custom_attributes: Dict[str, Any] - Attributes of the current client
- clients_attributes: Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]] - Attributes of all connected clients
- rooms_attributes: Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]] - Attributes of all available rooms
- current_room: Optional[str] - The current room the client is in

Methods:
- __init__(host: str = common.DEFAULT_HOST, port: int = common.DEFAULT_PORT) -> None - Initializes the client with server connection details
- __del__() -> None - Destructor that ensures proper disconnection
- connect() -> None - Establishes connection to the server and requests initial data
- disconnect() -> None - Closes the connection to the server
- is_connected() -> bool - Returns True if connected to the server
- send_command(command: common.Command) -> bool - Sends a command to the server
- handle_connection_lost() -> None - Handles cleanup when connection is lost
- fetch_incoming_commands() -> List[common.Command] - Receives and processes incoming commands from server
- fetch_outgoing_commands(commands_send_interval: int = 0) -> None - Sends pending commands to server
- fetch_commands(commands_send_interval: int = 0) -> List[common.Command] - Handles both incoming and outgoing commands
